name: Grid Cell and Subgrid Registration
description: Register horizontal grid cells and subgrid together
title: [EMD] Grid Cell and Subgrid:

field_guidance.grid_cells_description:
**Describe the physical grid cells.**

**Examples:**
- 'Regular latitude-longitude grid at 1.25° × 0.9° resolution'
- 'ORCA1 tripolar ocean grid with ~1° resolution'
- 'Spectral Gaussian grid for T127 truncation'

**Include:**
- Grid type and resolution
- Geographic coverage
- Purpose (atmosphere, ocean, etc.)

**This becomes the grid_cells entity description.**
field_guidance.grid_type:
**How cells are distributed:**

**Most common:**
- **regular-latitude-longitude**: Uniform lat-lon spacing (most models)
- **reduced-gaussian**: Gaussian with fewer points near poles
- **linear-spectral-gaussian**: Spectral transform representation
- **tripolar**: Ocean grid with 3 poles (Arctic split)
- **cubed-sphere**: Equal-area high-resolution atmosphere
- **unstructured-polygon**: Flexible irregular mesh
field_guidance.temporal_refinement:
**How the grid changes with time:**

- **static**: Fixed grid (most common)
- **adaptive**: Mesh refinement (dynamic adaptation)
- **dynamically-stretched**: Moving mesh (following features)

**Most models use static grids.**
field_guidance.x_resolution:
**Cell size in X (longitude) direction:**

**For lat-lon grids:** Degrees
- Coarse: 2-4°
- Standard: 1-2°
- High-res: 0.25-1°

**For spectral grids:** Leave blank, use truncation_number

**Omit if varies >25% across domain**
field_guidance.n_cells:
**Total horizontal cells:**

**Calculation for regular lat-lon:**
- Formula: (360/x_res) × (180/y_res)
- 1.25° × 0.9°: 288 × 200 = 57,600 cells
- 1° × 1°: 360 × 180 = 64,800 cells

**For irregular grids:** Check model documentation

**Leave blank if:** Adaptive/variable grids
field_guidance.truncation_number:
**Spectral truncation wavenumber:**

**Common values:**
- T42 (2.8° × 2.8° equivalent)
- T63 (1.9° × 1.9° equivalent)
- T127 (0.9° × 0.9° equivalent)
- T255 (0.5° × 0.5° equivalent)
- T511 (0.25° × 0.25° equivalent)

**Only for spectral/Gaussian grids**
field_guidance.subgrid_description:
**Describe this subgrid - what variables use these cells.**

**Examples:**
- 'Mass variables (temperature, pressure, tracers) on regular lat-lon grid'
- 'Velocity components on staggered positions'
- 'Spectral coefficients for atmospheric state variables'

**This becomes the subgrid entity description.**

**Different from grid_cells_description:**
- Grid cells = physical properties (resolution, cells)
- Subgrid = what's calculated there (variable types)
field_guidance.cell_variable_type:
**What types of variables are at this subgrid location:**

**Most common patterns:**

**Unstaggered (1 subgrid):**
- Select: mass, x-velocity, y-velocity

**Arakawa-C mass subgrid:**
- Select: mass

**Arakawa-C velocity subgrid:**
- Select: x-velocity, y-velocity

**Spectral subgrid:**
- Select: mass (spectral coefficients are mass-related)

**Types:**
- **mass**: Temperature, pressure, density, tracers, moisture
- **x-velocity**: U component (longitude direction)
- **y-velocity**: V component (latitude direction)  
- **velocity**: Full vector (unstructured grids)
